metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5098 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A use after free in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 60.0.3112.78 for Mac, Windows, Linux, and Android allowed a remote attacker to perform an out of bounds memory read via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5098` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 60.0.3112.78-0ubuntu1.1363
chromium-browser-l10n - 60.0.3112.78-0ubuntu1.1363
chromium-chromedriver - 60.0.3112.78-0ubuntu1.1363
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 60.0.3112.78-0ubuntu1.1363
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 60.0.3112.78-0ubuntu1.1363
No subscription required

notes.Note: mikesalvatore> The Ubuntu Security Team does not support libv8

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '60.0.3112.78-0ubuntu1.1363').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
